instructions: Image titled Use WhatsApp Step 1 1 Install Whatsapp . It's free to download from your phone's app store. Image titled Use WhatsApp Step 2 2 Open WhatsApp. Tap OPEN in your phone's app store, or tap the green and white WhatsApp app icon. Image titled Use WhatsApp Step 3 3 Tap when prompted. This will allow WhatsApp to access your contacts. You may also have to allow WhatsApp to send notifications by tapping Allow . On Android, you'll tap ALLOW here. Image titled Use WhatsApp Step 4 4 Tap . It's at the bottom of the screen. On Android, you'll tap AGREE AND CONTINUE . Image titled Use WhatsApp Step 5 5 Type in your phone number. You'll enter this in the text field in the middle of the page. Image titled Use WhatsApp Step 6 6 Tap . It's in the top-right corner of the screen. On Android, tap NEXT at the bottom of the screen instead. Image titled Use WhatsApp Step 7 7 Tap when prompted. Doing so will prompt WhatsApp to send a text message with a verification code. Image titled Use WhatsApp Step 8 8 Open your phone's messages. This should be the app where you send and receive messages. Image titled Use WhatsApp Step 9 9 Tap the message from WhatsApp. It will say "Your WhatsApp code is [###-###]. You can also tap on this link to verify your phone:" followed by a link. Image titled Use WhatsApp Step 10 10 Enter your code in the field provided. As long as you don't mistype, this will confirm your phone's identity and redirect you to the account creation page. Image titled Use WhatsApp Step 11 11 Enter your name and a photo. While the photo is optional, adding one will help confirm your identity to other contacts. If you've downloaded WhatsApp before, you'll first have an option to restore your chat history . You can also tap Use Facebook Info to use your Facebook picture and name. Image titled Use WhatsApp Step 12 12 Tap to continue. You are now ready to send a message with WhatsApp. Advertisement

Image titled Use WhatsApp Step 13 1 Tap . It's a tab at the bottom of the screen. On Android, you'll tap the CHATS tab at the top of the screen. Image titled Use WhatsApp Step 14 2 Tap the "New Chat" Image titled Iphonenewnote.png icon. This option is in the top-right corner of the screen. On Android, tap the white speech bubble on a green background in the bottom-right corner of the screen. Image titled Use WhatsApp Step 15 3 Select a contact. Tap the name of a contact with whom you want to chat. Doing so opens a chat with them. Image titled Use WhatsApp Step 16 4 Tap the chat box. It's at the bottom of the screen. Image titled Use WhatsApp Step 17 5 Enter chat text. Type in the message that you want to send. You can use your phone's built-in emoji keyboard to use emoji in your chat. Image titled Use WhatsApp Step 18 6 Send your chat. Tap the "Send" Image titled Android7send.png icon to the right of the chat box. You should see your chat appear on the right side of the message window. Advertisement

Image titled Use WhatsApp Step 19 1 Make sure you have a chat open. If you aren't currently in a chat with another contact, open or create one before proceeding. Image titled Use WhatsApp Step 20 2 Send a photo to the chat. If you want to take or select a photo to send to the chat, do the following: Tap the camera-shaped icon to the right of the text box. Tap OK or ALLOW when prompted two or three times. Select a photo or take a photo. Add a caption by entering one in the "Add a caption..." text box if necessary. Tap the "Send" Image titled Android7send.png icon. Image titled Use WhatsApp Step 21 3 Tap . It's in the bottom-left corner of the screen. A pop-up menu will appear. On Android, you'll tap the Image titled Android7paperclip.png icon on the right side of the chat box. Image titled Use WhatsApp Step 22 4 Select a type of file to send. Tap one of the following options depending on what you want to send to the chat: Document Allows you to choose a document, such as a PDF, from your smartphone's storage. Location Allows you to send a map of your current location. Contact Allows you to send a contact's information. Audio (Android only) Allows you to send an audio clip. Image titled Use WhatsApp Step 23 5 Send a document, contact, or location. Depending on what you chose in the last step, this process will vary: Document Go to the location of the document you want to send, select the document, and tap Send . Location Allow any permissions your smartphone requests, then tap Send Your Current Location to send the map. Contact Select a contact, confirm their details, and tap Send . Audio Select the audio you want to send, then tap OK . Image titled Use WhatsApp Step 24 6 Format your chat text . You can use different text tags to apply formatting, such as bolding, to message text: Bold Place an asterisk on either side of the text you want to bold (e.g., *hello* becomes hello ). Italics Place an underscore on either side of the text you want to italicize (e.g., _goodbye_ becomes goodbye ). Strikethrough Place a tilde on either side of the text you want to cross out (e.g., ~pineapple belongs on pizza~). Code Place three right-facing accent marks on either side of the text you want to use (e.g., ```I am a robot``` becomes I am a robot ). Advertisement

Image titled Use WhatsApp Step 25 1 Go back to the "Chats" page. Tap the "Back" button to do so. Image titled Use WhatsApp Step 26 2 Tap the "New Chat" Image titled Iphonenewnote.png icon. It's in the top-right corner of the screen. On Android, you'll tap the white-and-green icon in the bottom-right corner of the screen. Image titled Use WhatsApp Step 27 3 Select a contact. Tap the contact whom you want to call to open a chat with them. You can't make an audio or video call to more than one contact at a time. Image titled Use WhatsApp Step 28 4 Tap the "Call" icon. It's a phone-shaped icon in the upper-right side of the screen. Doing so will call your contact through WhatsApp. Image titled Use WhatsApp Step 29 5 Switch to a video call. Once the call connects, you can switch to a video call by tapping the video camera icon at the top of the screen. You can also lead with a video call by tapping it instead of the phone icon. Advertisement

Image titled Use WhatsApp Step 30 1 Go back to the "Chats" page. Tap the "Back" button to do so. Image titled Use WhatsApp Step 31 2 Tap the "New Chat" Image titled Iphonenewnote.png icon. It's in the top-right corner of the screen. On Android, you'll tap the white-and-green icon in the bottom-right corner of the screen. Image titled Use WhatsApp Step 32 3 Tap . This option is near the top of the page. Image titled Use WhatsApp Step 33 4 Enter the contact's first name. Tap the "First name" text box, then type in the contact's name. On Android, you'll tap the "Name" field instead. You can also enter their last name and company affiliation, but you must enter at least their first name here. Image titled Use WhatsApp Step 34 5 Tap . It's in the middle of the screen. On Android, you'll tap Phone here. Image titled Use WhatsApp Step 35 6 Enter the phone number. Type in the phone number of the person you want to add as a contact. This must be the phone number of a person who has WhatsApp installed and registered to their phone number. Image titled Use WhatsApp Step 36 7 Tap . It's in the top-right corner of the screen. On Android, you'll tap SAVE and then skip the next step. Image titled Use WhatsApp Step 37 8 Tap . This is in the upper-left side of the screen. Doing so adds the contact to your WhatsApp list of contacts. Image titled Use WhatsApp Step 38 9 Invite a friend to WhatsApp. If you want to add a friend who doesn't use WhatsApp, you can invite them to sign up for WhatsApp by doing the following: Open the "New Chat" page. Scroll all the way down to the bottom of the page, then tap Invite Friends to WhatsApp (on Android, you'll just tap Invite friends ). Select a method of invitation delivery (e.g., Message ). Enter your friend's contact information. Send the invitation. Advertisement

Image titled Use WhatsApp Step 39 1 Go back to the "Chats" page. Tap the "Back" button to do so. Image titled Use WhatsApp Step 40 2 Tap . It's at the top of the "Chats" page. Doing so opens a list of your WhatsApp contacts. On Android, you'll first tap in the top-right corner of the screen and then tap New group in the drop-down menu. Image titled Use WhatsApp Step 41 3 Select contacts for your group. Tap each contact you want to add to your group chat. You can have up to 256 people in a group chat. Image titled Use WhatsApp Step 42 4 Tap . It's in the top-right corner of the screen. On Android, you'll tap the right-facing arrow in the bottom-right corner of the screen. Image titled Use WhatsApp Step 43 5 Enter a group name. Type in whatever you want to name your group. There is a 25-character limit on your group's name. You can also upload a group photo by tapping the camera icon, selecting a photo type, and taking or selecting a photo. Image titled Use WhatsApp Step 44 6 Tap . It's in the top-right corner of the screen. This will create and open your group chat. On Android, you'll tap the Image titled Android7done.png icon here. Image titled Use WhatsApp Step 45 7 Message your group chat like usual. Once the group chat opens, you can send messages, files, and emoji like any other chat. Unfortunately, you can't voice- or video-call your group chat. Advertisement

Image titled Use WhatsApp Step 46 1 Go back to the "Chats" page. Tap the "Back" button to do so. Image titled Use WhatsApp Step 47 2 Tap . It's in the lower-left side of the screen. On Android, tap STATUS at the top of the screen. Image titled Use WhatsApp Step 48 3 Tap the camera icon. You'll see this to the right of the Status heading at the top of the page. If you want to create a text-only status, tap the pencil icon instead. On Android, the camera icon is in the bottom-right corner of the screen. Image titled Use WhatsApp Step 49 4 Create a status. Point your phone at an item you want to photograph, then tap the circular "Capture" button. If you're creating a text status, type in the text you want to use. You can also tap the paint palette icon to change the background color or tap the T to change the font of the text. Image titled Use WhatsApp Step 50 5 Tap the "Send" Image titled Android7send.png icon. It's in the lower-right corner of the screen. You may be prompted to confirm this choice. If so, tap Send again. Advertisement

Image titled Use WhatsApp Step 51 1 Tap the tab. It's at the bottom-center of the screen. Doing so opens the Camera interface. On Android, the Camera tab is actually a camera-shaped icon in the top-left corner of the screen. Image titled Use WhatsApp Step 52 2 Take a photo. Point your phone's camera at the item you want to photograph, then tap the circular "Capture" button near the bottom of the screen. You can also select a photo from your phone's Camera Roll. Image titled Use WhatsApp Step 53 3 Rotate the photo. Tap the box-shaped "Rotate" icon at the top of the screen, then tap the box-and-arrow icon in the lower-left side of the screen until your photo has adequately been rotated. You can then tap Done to save the changes. Image titled Use WhatsApp Step 54 4 Add stickers to the photo. Tap Image titled Android7emoji.png at the top of the screen, then select an emoji or a sticker from the resulting menu. Once you've added an emoji or a sticker, you can tap and drag it around the screen to reposition it on the photo. Image titled Use WhatsApp Step 55 5 Add text to the photo. Tap the T icon in the upper-right corner of the screen, select a color from the vertical color bar on the right side of the screen, and type in whatever text you want to add. Image titled Use WhatsApp Step 56 6 Draw on the photo. Tap the pencil-shaped icon in the top-right corner of the screen, then select a color from the vertical color bar on the right side of the screen and tap and drag across the photo. Image titled Use WhatsApp Step 57 7 Tap the "Send" Image titled Android7send.png icon. It's in the bottom-right corner of the screen. On Android, you'll tap Image titled Android7done.png here instead. Image titled Use WhatsApp Step 58 8 Select a location. You can send your photo to a chat by tapping the name of the chat or person in the "RECENT CHATS" section, or you can send it to your status by tapping My Status at the top of the page. Image titled Use WhatsApp Step 59 9 Tap . It's in the bottom-right corner of the screen. Doing so sends your photo. On Android, you'll tap the Image titled Android7send.png icon instead. Advertisement
